final_answer:
The image uses a satirical contrast between two scenarios depicted by the "YES" and "BUT" labels. 

On the left, the box is full of fresh strawberries, representing an ideal situation. On the right, however, the box shows fresh strawberries only on top, with rotten ones hidden underneath. This highlights a common deceptive practice where only the best parts are shown, hiding flaws or undesirable elements beneath the surface. The humor and satire come from the revelation of what lies beneath appearances, poking fun at how things are often not as perfect as they seem at first glance.
